text:
- So here at JFrog, we
believe in liquid software,
which means we want software to flow
through the whole development process
without any human intervention.
One of our flagship product, Artifactory,
helps enable that process.
- We moved to EKS about six years ago,

and that immediately fixed a
lot of our flexibility issues,
our scalability issues, networking issues.

- We are multi-region and
we're across the globe.
Having the stability and reliability,

the flexibility with EKS
allows us to go anywhere.

- The integrated support for
Terraform within Amazon EKS,

really, the flexibility of
being able to move faster,

get to production faster, and
actually scale a lot easier
than we were before.

- Had a few on-prem customers
ask us about if Artifactory

and some of our products
were supported on Graviton.

From there, we had our CTO
team, our architect team,
go and do a couple tests.

Off their initial tests, they
realized that Graviton gave us

a 10% in performance as well
as close to 20% in cost.

- The carbon footprint that we
have here at JFrog by moving

to the Graviton machine types
within our Amazon EKS clusters
has reduced by 60%.

- The adoption of EKS
definitely sets us apart
from a lot of other customers.

One of the things that we're
able to achieve now is really,

truly grow our product and our
application without feeling

the constraints of either
cost or performance.
(upbeat music)
